dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And a huge part of that is because Walmart's stock jumped almost 9% after their earnings report.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And a huge part of that is because Walmart's stock jumped almost nine percent after their earnings report.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even in the era of e-commerce, Walmart reported earnings that pleased Wall Street on Thursday morning, sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which, by the way, added like 12 billion dollars to the Waltons' net worth in just one day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, by the way, added like twelve billion dollars to the Waltons' net worth in just one day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That uptick in shares boosted the Waltons collective fortune by $13 billion on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That earnings report also pushed Alice Walton back to being the world's richest woman, worth 46.5 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That earnings report also pushed Alice Walton back to being the world's richest woman, worth forty six point five billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so she overtook Francoise Bettencourt Meyers from L'Oreal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so she overtook Francoise Bettencourt Meyers from L'Oreal?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And her brothers Jim and Rob are right up there too, each around 46 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And her brothers Jim and Rob are right up there too, each around forty six billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She and her brothers Jim, 70 (net worth: $46.4 billion) and Rob, 73 ($46.2 billion), all rank among the nations top 20 richest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting how Walmart's really pushing into online and grocery to compete with Amazon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting how Walmart's really pushing into online and grocery to compete with Amazon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they mentioned expanding grocery delivery to 42% of the U.S. and having pickup at over 1,800 locations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they mentioned expanding grocery delivery to forty two percent of the U.S. and having pickup at over eighteen hundred locations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is smart, since Amazon bought Whole Foods to get into that space.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is smart, since Amazon bought Whole Foods to get into that space.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And if Walmart keeps performing like this, the article says the Waltons could become the first 205 billion dollar family in history.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if Walmart keeps performing like this, the article says the Waltons could become the first two hundred five billion dollar family in history.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By our estimates, theyll be the first $200 billion family in history.

dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just... I mean, how do you even wrap your head around that number?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It really shows the enduring power of Walmart, even in the age of e-commerce giants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really shows the enduring power of Walmart, even in the age of e-commerce giants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The fact that the Walton fortune is still bigger than Bezos says something about the enduring nature of Walmart.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's not just Bezos dominating; legacy retail is holding its own.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's not just Bezos dominating; legacy retail is holding its own.

artist_script:
HostA: 157 billion dollars. That's what Jeff Bezos was worth on Wednesday, thanks to Amazon's stock surge.
HostB: Yeah, but the real story here is the Walton family—they're still way ahead, with a combined fortune of about 175 billion.
HostA: Right, and that's seven people sharing that wealth, which is just mind-boggling when you think about it.
HostB: And a huge part of that is because Walmart's stock jumped almost 9% after their earnings report.
HostA: Which, by the way, added like 12 billion dollars to the Waltons' net worth in just one day.
HostB: That earnings report also pushed Alice Walton back to being the world's richest woman, worth 46.5 billion.
HostA: Oh wow, so she overtook Francoise Bettencourt Meyers from L'Oreal?
HostB: Exactly. And her brothers Jim and Rob are right up there too, each around 46 billion.
HostA: It's interesting how Walmart's really pushing into online and grocery to compete with Amazon.
HostB: Yeah, they mentioned expanding grocery delivery to 42% of the U.S. and having pickup at over 1,800 locations.
HostA: Which is smart, since Amazon bought Whole Foods to get into that space.
HostB: And if Walmart keeps performing like this, the article says the Waltons could become the first 205 billion dollar family in history.
HostA: That's just… I mean, how do you even wrap your head around that number?
HostB: It really shows the enduring power of Walmart, even in the age of e-commerce giants.
HostA: Absolutely. It’s not just Bezos dominating; legacy retail is holding its own.
